page.title: 01Introduction to our area.
page.content: Our 12sq.kms covered the northern part of Hailsham in East Sussex and the surrounding villages of{Hellingly, {Horsebridge,and Lower Dicker.}Hailsham is a market town of some l7000 people, but the picturesque village of {Hellingly}is the main settlement in our area. The land was mainly forested and in later times iron and brick works were found including an old pottery. Todays economy is based on mixed farming. The inhabitants are either retired, farmers,commuters to various parts of Sussex or workers in a few local industries. Hellingly derived its name from{'hill dwellers' being situated just north of the marshes. Although present during the last Domesday survey it did not register. Its growth has been steady with many old and beautiful farms.Two mental hospitals are todays features.
